image.altText: A man wearing a suit but no tie walking next to a female reporter

props.synopsis: Jason Paul Hagon continued to indecently assault female clients at his home-based business despite police issuing him with a warning after the first complainant came forward.

title.children: 'Arrogant' massage therapist jailed for indecently assaulting clients despite police warning

image.altText: Riddoch Highway sign shows directional pointers to Penola, Mt Gambier, Keith and Naracoorte

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old girl has become the second person to die in a three-car smash in South Australia's south-east. The teenager and a five-year-old boy, who died at the scene on Sunday, were passengers in a car that was rear-ended.

title.children: Man charged over three-car crash involving emu after death of second child

image.altText: Person sitting on a couch working on a laptop

props.synopsis: A tribunal finds a council employee who tripped over a 60-centimetre pet fence during a coffee break while working from home is entitled to workers compensation.

title.children: Council employee who tripped over pet fence while working from home wins compensation claim

image.altText: A pile of burnt blue batteries on asphalt

props.synopsis: Australia's annual lithium-ion battery waste is tipped to hit 137,000 tonnes by 2035, and with 90 per cent of current waste going into landfill or getting stockpiled, there are urgent calls for dedicated recycling facilities.Â

title.children: Lithium-ion recycling facilities 'urgently' needed as toxic waste soars in Australia

image.altText: A smiling elderly lady in a blue sweater holding an orchid in her home garden with more plants behind her.

props.synopsis: Nancy Murdock has been part of the Riverland Relay for Life event for 17 years, but the three-time cancer survivor has taken her last lap around the oval.

title.children: Nancy has lost six family members to cancer and survived it three times. Yet, she is 'hopeful' about the future

image.altText: A mining pit on green farmland.

props.synopsis: Rare earths are seen as a strategic and economic opportunity for Australia, but some producers worry it could come at the cost of rich farmland.Â

title.children: Rare earth elements are key to Australia's energy transition. But not all are happy to dig them up

image.altText: Raina Cruise wearing sunglasses outdoors

props.synopsis: A female police officer was pregnant when she was assaulted by anti-vaccine protester and failed South Australian Senate candidate Raina Cruise in Adelaide's CBD, a court has heard.

title.children: Police officer assaulted by woman outside pub was pregnant at the time, court told

image.altText: Simon Middleton

props.synopsis: Prosecutors dropped a murder charge against Matthew Harmati, who was one of two men accused of the shooting death of Simon Middleton in Adelaide's north in 2021.

title.children: Prosecution drops murder charge over 'execution-style' killing

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese Blue Room

props.synopsis: The prime minister says he only remembers limited interactions with former Qantas boss Alan Joyce, and if there are specific claims he made direct calls to ask for free upgrades, "let them be made".

title.children: Dutton says Albanese should refer himself for corruption investigation over Qantas upgrades

image.altText: Owner of a Go Cart venue standing next to the track.

props.synopsis: Michelle McClurg has been wondering for over 15 years if the government was going to knock down her house due to the public acquisition overlay on the area.Â

title.children: 'Gut-wrenching': When the government acquired this man's property, he had to accept their terms

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a yellow cap and gestures against a stars and stripes background

props.synopsis: It is the first legal action to be brought over the America PAC sweepstakes which offer $US1 million every day until November 5 for people who have signed a petition.

title.children: Philadelphia district attorney sues Elon Musk over $US1m election giveaways

image.altText: Two women wearing hijabs.

props.synopsis: Haje Nahed Hijazi was about to fall asleep in Sydney when her daughter Zainab told her the Lebanese home their family was taking refuge in had been hit by an Israeli air strike that is under review by Israel Defense Forces.

title.children: Zainab and her mother lost 19 family members in an Israeli air strike. They will 'never be the same again'

image.altText: Two signes outside a shop that read "MYER"

props.synopsis: Department store giant Myer will purchase a slew of fashion chains, giving it ownership of nearly 800 retail stores across Australia and New Zealand.

title.children: Myer buys more than 700 fashion stores, including Just Jeans, Portmans and Jay Jays

image.altText: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump looking at each other in election illustration

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is facing serious backlash over comments made by opening speakers at his Madison Square Garden rally â here's the latest updates from the US election.

title.children: Trump campaign responds to Puerto Rico backlash as FBI investigates ballot box arson â the latest from the US election campaign trail

image.altText: Singer Chris Martin on stage singing with a microphone in his hand and fans in the background

props.synopsis: Fans desperate to get their hands on Coldplay tickets have been warned to beware of online scams orchestrated by cybercriminals seeking to exploit their fear of missing out.

title.children: Trying to buy last-minute Coldplay tickets? Watch out for online scams

image.altText: A man in a suit with a few police officers.

props.synopsis: The Queensland Police Service has confirmed it will exceed its budget for the 2024-2025 financial year due to "rising costs and approved commitments".

title.children: New Queensland premier assures there will be no impact on frontline policing despite budget overspend

image.altText: Toxic chemical symbols super-imposed on an a photo of a cotton bulb.

props.synopsis: A cotton industry advocate says dryland crops are at risk if the regulator lowers the usage rate of a chemical that has been linked to Parkinson's disease.

title.children: Cotton Australia doesn't want to see the chemical paraquat banned as it would put its industry at risk

image.altText: A photo of Todd Mengaldo in a hoodie kneeling down.

props.synopsis: Police have located Todd Menegaldo, who is wanted for questioning following the assault death of Seddon man Andrew Truman.

title.children: Police arrest man wanted in connection to deadly Melbourne CBD assault after weeks-long manhunt

image.altText: A brunette woman stands in the street holding a cup of ice cream. She wears a white tank top and denim skirt.

props.synopsis: Egg freezing is often sold by fertility clinics as an "insurance policy". But some experts say it's more like a lottery, and few women return to use their frozen eggs.

title.children: Freezing eggs is sold as an 'insurance policy', but few women go on to use them

image.altText: Sean 'Diddy' Combs

props.synopsis: The California plaintiff accuses the music mogul of spiking his drink and forcing him to perform oral sex after the then-10-year-old said he would "do anything" to become a star.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs accused of drugging and sexually assaulting 10-year-old boy during 'audition'

image.altText: A man with a long beard and black robe speaks into a microphone while sitting next to a short desk.

props.synopsis: The nation's peak Jewish body launches legal action against an Islamic preacher and religious centre in Western Sydney over alleged anti-Semitic speeches.

title.children: Jewish organisation takes legal action against Sydney Islamic preacher and religious centre

image.altText: Displaced Palestinians wait to receive United Nations Relief and Works Agency (UNRWA) aid, in Rafah

props.synopsis: The Coalition suggests redirecting funds from the United Nations aid group working in Gaza after Israel passed laws declaring UNRWA a terror organisation and banning its operations within its borders.

title.children: Coalition calls for UNRWA funding to be diverted to other aid groups after laws passed to ban group from Israel

image.altText: An older man in a red shirt standing in front of a tree

props.synopsis: When spraying crops, John O'Brien would end up covered in chemicals including paraquat. He's one of six farmers from Crookwell who say they have been diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease.

title.children: Six farmers grew up in the same tiny town getting 'covered' in chemicals. They all now have Parkinson's

image.altText: Several trees with snapped trunks in a park

props.synopsis: Glen Eira council is appealing for the community to help identify offenders who cut down, ripped out and killed hundreds of thousands of dollars worth of young trees in parks in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Hundreds of trees vandalised at multiple parks in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Just Jeans store in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Department store Myer strikes a deal for Premier Investment's clothing brands, and investors in Premier cheer the news. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX rises, Premier rallies on Just Jeans, Dotti deal

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios looks up

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios says he 'could come back now and beat 50 per cent of players' if he wanted to, but that his fans deserve more.

title.children: 'I could come back now and beat 50 per cent of players': Kyrgios opens up on tennis comeback plans

image.altText: An older man with grey hair and glasses, wearing a suit, looks into the camera, one hand in his pocket

props.synopsis: Michael Brand is set to depart the Sydney art gallery in July, less than three years after the completion of the $344 million Sydney Modern project.

title.children: Michael Brand raised $110 million to transform Sydney's major art gallery. He soon leaves the top job

image.altText: Two beef cattle

props.synopsis: Many Australian farmers are getting squeezed at "both ends" by concentrated markets.

title.children: Australia's small-scale farmers are 'meat in a market concentration sandwich'

image.altText: A man with an arm around a woman standing together in front of an ambulance

props.synopsis: She made international headlines after becoming stuck in a rock crevice in the Hunter Valley for seven hours. Today, the 23-year-old was reunited with the team who rescued her.

title.children: Rescuers removed 'one rock at a time' to free woman trapped upside down in rock crevice

image.altText: Three women stir large pots of curry, as they prepare lunch at the Sikh Temple in Woolgoolga.

props.synopsis: On New South Wales' Mid North Coast, a town boasts a population where 25 per cent is of Indian heritage. Originally settling for agricultural opportunities, there is a deeper reason the Punjabi Sikhs stay in Woolgoolga.

title.children: The migration of the Punjabi Sikhs of Woolgoolga, and what keeps them in town

image.altText: A farmer on a tractor moving on a field of dirt with mountains in the distance

props.synopsis: Farming and aid groups are warning the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah could affect food supplies in Lebanon and Syria and push hundreds of thousands of people into long-term poverty.

title.children: Olive oil, bananas and avocado: How Israel and Hezbollah's deadly war is impacting much-needed food supplies

image.altText: a woman with a red blazer smiles inside a train station

props.synopsis: Travellers to Japan may have picked up on a familiar accent while riding the Shinkansen between Tokyo and the southern island of Kyushu.

title.children: The Aussie woman behind the English announcements on Japan's busiest bullet trains

image.altText: A woman holds and looks down at a baby onesie while standing in a room.

props.synopsis: Nicky has been living in a two-bedroom motel with her children after rental demand skyrocketed in south-east Queensland.

title.children: Pregnant mother with 'guaranteed income' left homeless after almost 100 unsuccessful rental applications

image.altText: Moody image of a person dressed in dark work clothes

props.synopsis: Preliminary results of a global survey show Australia has some of the highest rates of work addiction. Managers, people with a demanding job and those with family members addicted to work are at the highest risk of developing a work addiction.

title.children: A quarter of Australians are addicted to work, preliminary research finds
